div.p: I pray to the Lord God and our heavenly Father for the most prosperous entry and progress of the present year for you and yours. I also hope that you, my most esteemed lord and friend, and yours are in good health. By God's grace, I and mine are quite well. As for the state of our affairs, nothing occurs to me now that I consider worthy of writing, except that the things that happened in the Netherlands some time ago have now been more clearly reported to us. I send these inscribed on the present sheet along with a few others to you. Otherwise, everything is in the utmost silence everywhere. Rumor says that within a few weeks new plans and new expeditions will emerge, which, although I think it is fabricated, the current state of affairs makes it not unlike the truth. Furthermore, I ask you to receive with your usual kindness the small gift, namely the 8 gold coins enclosed here, which I send to you in the customary name of New Year's gifts.
Your most observant, Georg von Stetten.
To the venerable, pious, and learned lord Heinrich Bullinger, the most vigilant Antistes of the Church of Zürich, his esteemed lord and friend. In Zürich.
